pull.title: cmake: Disable eager MSan in ctime_tests
pull.body:
Same as https://github.com/bitcoin-core/secp256k1/pull/1517, but for the CMakle build system.

The second commit improves the configure summary (similar to https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/pull/189.

repo.name: secp256k1
repo.description: Optimized C library for EC operations on curve secp256k1

repo.name: secp256k1
repo.description: Optimized C library for EC operations on curve secp256k1

issue.title: autotools: Disable eager MSan in ctime_tests
issue.body:
This is the autotools solution for #1516. 

Alternatively, we could have a full-blown `--enable-msan` option, but it's more work, and I'm not convinced that it's necessary or at least much better.

hebasto If you're Concept ACK, are you willing to work on an equivalent PR for CMake?

cmake: Disable `ctime_tests` if build with `-fsanitize=memory`

Clang >= 16 has `-fsanitize-memory-param-retval` turned on by default,
which is incompatible with

verification.payload:
tree 22f6aa6245c897bfa7bf473f50fa2ebe6162d802
parent 1cd7c1c0ce8b68fe706fa2ffb1bb0d0218b4915f
author Hennadii Stepanov <32963518+hebasto@users.noreply.github.com> 1716735222 +0100
committer Hennadii Stepanov <32963518+hebasto@users.noreply.github.com> 1716813627 +0100

cmake: Report more compiler details in summary

events.message: cmake: Report more compiler details in summary

events.body:
Addressed comments:
- https://github.com/bitcoin-core/secp256k1/pull/1532#discussion_r1615986643:
> avoid `//` comments which are invalid in C89

- https://github.com/bitcoin-core/secp256k1/pull/1532#discussion_r1615994037
> Actually, why are you hard coding compiler IDs at all? This just makes things less flexible, and the check should be enough.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,16 @@
+include_guard(GLOBAL)
+include(CheckCSourceCompiles)
+
+function(check_memory_sanitizer output)
+  set(CMAKE_TRY_COMPILE_TARGET_TYPE STATIC_LIBRARY)
+  check_c_source_compiles("
+    #if defined(__has_feature)
+    #  if __has_feature(memory_sanitizer)
+    //   MemorySanitizer is enabled.
comments.body: nit: We should probably use the same test program on configure and CMake (and perhaps avoid `//` comments which are invalid in C89, though that really is more of a philosophical concern.)

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -263,6 +263,17 @@ endif()
 
 set(CMAKE_C_VISIBILITY_PRESET hidden)
 
+set(print_msan_notice)
+if(SECP256K1_BUILD_CTIME_TESTS AND CMAKE_C_COMPILER_ID MATCHES "^(Clang|AppleClang)$")
comments.body: Does Apple Clang makes sense here?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -263,6 +263,17 @@ endif()
 
 set(CMAKE_C_VISIBILITY_PRESET hidden)
 
+set(print_msan_notice)
+if(SECP256K1_BUILD_CTIME_TESTS AND CMAKE_C_COMPILER_ID MATCHES "^(Clang|AppleClang)$")
comments.body: Actually, why are you hard coding compiler IDs at all? This just makes things less flexible, and the check should be enough.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -263,6 +263,17 @@ endif()
 
 set(CMAKE_C_VISIBILITY_PRESET hidden)
 
+set(print_msan_notice)
+if(SECP256K1_BUILD_CTIME_TESTS AND CMAKE_C_COMPILER_ID MATCHES "^(Clang|AppleClang)$")
comments.body: Yeah, I had the same thought. It saves a test compilation for GCC, but it's probably simpler to drop the check for clang. In https://github.com/bitcoin-core/secp256k1/pull/1517, I also added a similar check (but for "GCC or Clang", so it's much more useless). Let's just drop it.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,16 @@
+include_guard(GLOBAL)
+include(CheckCSourceCompiles)
+
+function(check_memory_sanitizer output)
+  set(CMAKE_TRY_COMPILE_TARGET_TYPE STATIC_LIBRARY)
+  check_c_source_compiles("
+    #if defined(__has_feature)
+    #  if __has_feature(memory_sanitizer)
+    //   MemorySanitizer is enabled.
comments.body:
> nit: We should probably use the same test program on configure and CMake

I'd prefer to align Autotools' `SECP_MSAN_CHECK` code with CMake's `check_memory_sanitizer` to keep the latter straightforward without negated values.

> ... and perhaps avoid `//` comments which are invalid in C89

Thanks. [Fixed](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/secp256k1/pull/1532#issuecomment-2133405610).

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -263,6 +263,17 @@ endif()
 
 set(CMAKE_C_VISIBILITY_PRESET hidden)
 
+set(print_msan_notice)
+if(SECP256K1_BUILD_CTIME_TESTS AND CMAKE_C_COMPILER_ID MATCHES "^(Clang|AppleClang)$")
comments.body:
> Actually, why are you hard coding compiler IDs at all? This just makes things less flexible, and the check should be enough.

Thanks! The compiler ID check has been [deleted](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/secp256k1/pull/1532#issuecomment-2133405610).

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,16 @@
+include_guard(GLOBAL)
+include(CheckCSourceCompiles)
+
+function(check_memory_sanitizer output)
+  set(CMAKE_TRY_COMPILE_TARGET_TYPE STATIC_LIBRARY)
+  check_c_source_compiles("
+    #if defined(__has_feature)
+    #  if __has_feature(memory_sanitizer)
+    //   MemorySanitizer is enabled.
comments.body:
> I'd prefer to align Autotools' `SECP_MSAN_CHECK` code with CMake's `check_memory_sanitizer` to keep the latter straightforward without negated values.

Fine with that if you want to add a commit that makes them consistent, but then we'll also need to `#error` if `!defined(__has_feature)`.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -263,6 +263,17 @@ endif()
 
 set(CMAKE_C_VISIBILITY_PRESET hidden)
 
+set(print_msan_notice)
+if(SECP256K1_BUILD_CTIME_TESTS AND CMAKE_C_COMPILER_ID MATCHES "^(Clang|AppleClang)$")
comments.body: Thanks, do you want to add a commit that also removes the `$GCC` check in configure.ac, just to keep the system consistent?
